learning_objective: Modify, remix, or incorporate portions of an existing program into one's own work, to develop something new or add more advanced features.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is developing an inventory management program for their family's grocery store. Alex noticed that the application used by their cousin's hardware store has a useful feature for tracking stock. How can Alex use this for their grocery inventory management program dynamically to monitor and update grocery items in stock?",
    "Answer1": "By completely rewriting the program and only borrowing the UI design",
    "Answer2": "By copying the entire application's code and using it as their own",
    "Answer3": "By identifying the parts of the cousin's application that deals with stock tracking and incorporating similar logic into their grocery program",
    "Answer4": "By creating an entirely new feature that's unrelated to stock tracking",
    "CorrectAnswer": "3",
    "Explanation": "The best approach would be to understand, modify and incorporate only the parts of the cousin's program that handle stock tracking - this aligns with the principle of reusing and remixing existing code to create something new or add more features to a program.",
    "code_snippet": "action updateInventory(item : text, quantity : integer)\n    if items:HasKey(item)\n        integer currentStock = items:Get(item)\n        items:Set(item, currentStock + quantity)\n    else\n        items:Set(item, quantity)\n    end\nend"
}
